{
    "number": 192596,
    "data": "1,7,31,97,127,409,601,769,1231,1657,1831,2017,2311,3079,3169,3457,3631,3697,3943,4201,4999,5479,5521,5881,6079,6151,6607,6961,7057,7129,7321,7417,7687,8089,8161,8431,9127,9241,9337,9511,9631,9871,10009",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and 3x+4y is a prime, then 3x+4y is in S, and 1 is in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussions at A192476 and A192580."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {1}; primes = Table[Prime[n], {n, 1, 10000}];",
        "f[x_, y_] := If[MemberQ[primes, 3 x + 4 y], 3 x + 4 y]",
        "b[x_] :=",
        "  Block[{w = x},",
        "   Select[Union[",
        "     Flatten[AppendTo[w,",
        "       Table[f[w[[i]], w[[j]]], {i, 1, Length[w]}, {j, 1,",
        "         Length[w]}]]]], # < 20000 &]];",
        "t = FixedPoint[b, start]    (* A192596 *)",
        "PrimePi[t]   (* A192597 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192574, A192580, A192597."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 05 2011",
    "references": 2,
    "revision": 4,
    "time": "2012-03-30T18:57:36-04:00",
    "created": "2011-07-06T13:16:36-04:00"
}
